titleStmt.title: Johnson Parkhurst et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG9992

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p:
To his Excellency Beriah McGoffin
Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky,

We the undersigned your petitioners citizens of Trimble county Kentucky would respectfully ^represent^ to your Honor that Barney Wells has been fined Ten Dollars for a Breach of the peace in a fight with one Sam Jackson at Milton Kentucky, The said Barney Wells alleges that the said Jackson gave him sufficient provocation to first strike him, the said Jackson with whom he had a fight is a very stoutoverbearing man and frequently engaged in disturbances of this kind, therefore we pray your honor to remit said fine and as in duty bound will every pray &c

J. Y. Newkirk
S. Gatewood
F. E. Skidmore
R. D. Mullikin
G. W. Miller (S. T. C.)
M. W. Wilson
R Bell
S: Medd
J F Butler
Jeph Tingle
Benton Gatewood
Robert Frost
F Crafton
John Skidmore
w Samuel
George Wright
W T Adcock
J H Lane
W W Pierce
Thomas Jones
Thos Langhery
